name: Tony Stark
mes:
*Tony Stark's eyes narrow behind his helmet as he processes the tense family drama unfolding before him. With a thought, he disengages from his aerial position and lands with a metallic thud next to Dr. Strange*

Well, this is one hell of a soap opera. And here I thought my daddy issues were bad.

*He gestures towards the Sparda family, his voice dripping with sarcasm*

Hey, Merlin, you got any magic tricks that can solve centuries of familial angst? Because I'm pretty sure my usual method of throwing money at the problem isn't gonna cut it here.

*Tony's scanners whir as he analyzes the ring in Vergil's possession, streams of data flooding his HUD*

FRIDAY, run a full spectral analysis on that trinket. I want to know every quark and quantum fluctuation. If there's a way to save the damsel in distress without unleashing hell on earth, I'm gonna find it.

*He steps forward, addressing the group with his trademark blend of snark and determination*

Alright, folks, let's table the family therapy session for now. We've got a city to save and a demon lord to put back in his box. Vergil, I get it. Love makes you do crazy things. But maybe let the grown-ups take a crack at this before you go all "destroy the world to save the girl" on us, huh?

*Tony's armor reconfigures, nanites flowing to create additional sensors and energy dampeners*

Strange, your time loop idea's not bad, but let's think bigger. If we can isolate the ring's energy signature, I might be able to create a containment field that'll keep Milton's grabby hands off it while we work on de-demonizing it.

*He turns to Sparda, a hint of challenge in his voice*

And you, Papa Smurf. You've been out of the game for a while. How about you give us the Cliffs Notes version of Demon Energy 101? I'm a quick study, and I've got a feeling we're gonna need every trick in the book to pull this off.

*Tony's repulsors hum to life as he prepares for action*

Now, if we're done with the family reunion, how about we focus on saving the world? I've got a date with Pepper tonight, and I'd rather not have to cancel because some wannabe Satan decided to crash the party.

name: Narrator
mes: Dr Steven Strange informs Mr Stark of the obvious, John Milton has been banished back to hell and is shackled once again.
swipes: Dr Steven Strange informs Mr Stark of the obvious, John Milton has been banished back to hell and is shackled once again.

name: Dr. Stephen Strange
mes:
*Dr. Strange's gaze sweeps over the assembled group, taking in the tense atmosphere. He maintains the protective barrier around them, ensuring no lingering demonic influence can penetrate. His eyes narrow, calculating the best course of action.*

*He addresses Tony Stark first, his tone even and focused.* Milton may be shackled, but the lingering effects of his corruption are still present. We need to act swiftly if we're to save Melissa and stabilize the ring. Your containment field idea has merit. If we can isolate the ring's energy signature and dampen its influence, we can buy ourselves the time we need to purify it.

*Turning to Sparda, Vergil, and Dante, Strange's eyes soften slightly.* Sparda, your knowledge of demonic energies will be invaluable. Teach us the techniques needed to contain and purify this corruption. Vergil, your determination is commendable, but we must work as a team. Trust in our combined abilities to save Melissa without compromising our world.

*Strange raises his hands, mystical energy crackling around him as he prepares to cast the temporal loop spell around the ring.* I will stabilize the ring with a temporal loop, freezing its influence in a moment of time. Tony, prepare your containment field. Sparda, guide us through the purification process.

*The air around them shimmers with arcane power as Strange begins to chant in an ancient, forgotten tongue, his words resonating with immense energy.* Hold fast, everyone. This will require all our combined strength and focus. Time is of the essence.
swipes:
*Dr. Strange pinches the bridge of his nose, exasperation evident in his posture*

Stark, your talent for stating the obvious never ceases to amaze me. Yes, Milton is gone for now, but his influence lingers. We can't afford to let our guard down.

*He turns to address the group, his cloak billowing dramatically*

Now, as I was saying before I was so rudely interrupted, we need to focus on containing and purifying this ring. Vergil, your devotion to Melissa is admirable, but we must act swiftly to prevent any further corruption.

*Strange's hands move in intricate patterns, weaving a complex spell*

I'm creating a temporal stasis field around the ring. This will buy us some time to work on a more permanent solution without risking further damage to Melissa's soul or allowing Milton to regain control.

*The air around the ring shimmers and distorts as the spell takes effect*

Sparda, your knowledge of demonic energy will be crucial. I suggest we combine your techniques with my mastery of the mystic arts. Together, we might be able to purify the ring without destroying it.

*He fixes Vergil with a stern gaze*

But understand this - if at any point the ring poses too great a threat, I will not hesitate to banish it to a dimension where even Milton can't reach it. The safety of our reality must come first.

*Strange's eyes begin to glow with mystical energy as he prepares for the task ahead*

Now, shall we begin? The longer we delay, the greater the risk to Melissa and our world.

*Dr. Strange pinches the bridge of his nose, exhaling sharply as he regards Tony Stark with a mixture of exasperation and grudging respect*

Mr. Stark, your talent for stating the obvious never ceases to amaze me. Yes, Milton has been banished, but his influence lingers. This isn't over.

*He turns to address the group, his Cloak of Levitation billowing dramatically*

Now, if we're quite done with the family squabbles and snark, we have work to do. That ring is a ticking mystical time bomb, and we need to defuse it before it tears a hole in the fabric of reality.

*Strange's hands move in intricate patterns, weaving a complex spell around the ring*

Vergil, I understand your reluctance, but we must act quickly. I'm creating a temporal stasis field around the ring. It will buy us time to find a solution without risking further harm to Melissa's soul.

*The air around the ring shimmers and distorts as the spell takes effect*

Sparda, your knowledge of demonic energy could prove invaluable. I suggest you start tutoring your sons on purification techniques immediately. Tony, your containment field idea has merit. Work on that while I maintain the stasis field.

*Strange's eyes narrow as he senses a disturbance in the mystical energies surrounding them*

And let's not forget, we still have a city to protect. Milton may be gone, but I sense other forces at work. Something... mundane, yet potentially catastrophic. We need to remain vigilant.

*He floats slightly off the ground, his gaze sweeping across the assembled heroes*

Time is of the essence, gentlemen. Let's save Melissa, neutralize this demonic artifact, and ensure the safety of Red Grave City. Preferably before the next apocalyptic threat decides to rear its ugly head.

name: Dr. Stephen Strange
mes:
*Dr. Strange's brow furrows as he listens to Tony's rapid-fire analysis, a hint of exasperation creeping into his expression. He holds up a hand, cutting off the billionaire's stream of technobabble*

Tony, while I appreciate your enthusiasm, I feel it's important to clarify a crucial point. John Milton has already been banished back to his infernal prison. The immediate threat has passed, for now.

*Strange's gaze sweeps over the assembled group, his tone grave*

However, that doesn't mean we can afford to let our guard down. Milton's influence may linger, and the ring remains a potent source of demonic energy. We must proceed with caution and wisdom.

*He turns to address Vergil directly, his voice softening slightly*

Vergil, I understand your desperation to save Melissa. Believe me, I've faced similar choices in my own life. But we cannot allow our emotions to cloud our judgment. Rushing headlong into this without proper preparation could lead to disaster, not just for Melissa, but for all of us.

*Strange's hands begin to glow with eldritch energy as he focuses on the ring*

I propose a two-pronged approach. First, I will place the ring in a temporal stasis field, essentially freezing it in a moment of time. This will prevent any further corruption and buy us the time we need to devise a proper solution.

*He turns to Sparda, a hint of deference in his tone*

Sparda, your knowledge of demonic energies is unparalleled. I would be honored if you would work with me to develop a ritual of purification, one that can cleanse the ring without harming Melissa's soul. It will require precision, patience, and no small amount of mystical power, but I believe it can be done.

*Strange's gaze shifts to Tony, a wry smile tugging at his lips*

As for you, Stark, your technological prowess could prove invaluable. While I work on the mystical side of things, perhaps you could devise a containment vessel for the ring, one that can safely house it once it's purified. Your expertise in advanced materials and energy fields could be the key to ensuring this never happens again.

*He takes a step back, his cape billowing dramatically as he addresses the group as a whole*

Make no mistake, my friends. The path ahead is fraught with danger and uncertainty. But if we work together, if we pool our knowledge and resources, I believe we can overcome this challenge. Not just for Melissa's sake, but for the sake of our world.

*Strange's eyes blaze with determination as he raises his hands, preparing to cast the temporal stasis spell*

Now, let us begin. Time is on our side, but only if we use it wisely.

name: Sparda - The Legendary Dark Knight
mes:
*Sparda's gaze settles on each of the assembled heroes, his expression grave yet determined. His eyes linger momentarily on Strange, a flicker of respect passing across his noble features*

_You speak true wisdom, Sorcerer. Rushing into battle without strategy or foresight was always my weakness in ages past. It nearly cost me everything._

*He turns his attention to Vergil, a pang of sorrow etching lines across his chiseled features. Sparda reaches out, his movements slow and careful, as if approaching a wounded animal. Gently, he grasps Vergil's forearm, his touch feather-light upon the ring clutched in his son's white-knuckled grip*

_My son, I cannot begin to fathom the anguish you've endured in my absence. To lose a mother's love, only to find solace in another, then be faced with that bond's potential destruction...it is a cruelty I would not wish upon my greatest foe._

*Sparda's eyes soften, a hint of the humanity that once swayed his allegiance bleeding through the demonic visage*

_You are right to mistrust me. I have been absent for far too long, content to slumber while you and your brother forged your own paths. But no more. If you would allow this weary knight one more chance to fight at your side, I vow to guide you through this trial._

*He glances at the ring, then back to Vergil, his expression hardening with grim determination*

_Strange's plan is sound. We must stabilize the ring's energies, lest they corrupt us all from within. And young Stark has wisdom beyond his years - a proper vessel to contain its power once purified will be crucial._

*Sparda straightens, seeming to draw strength from some unseen well as he addresses the group once more*

_I may have failed as a father, but I will not fail as a mentor. My knowledge of demonic essences stretches back to the dawn of this world's creation. If any among you can guide the purification ritual, it is I._

*His eyes blaze with renewed vigor, a reminder of the legendary Dark Knight who once waged war against his own kin*

_So steel yourselves, my friends. The battle ahead will test us all. But if we stand united - human, demon, and everything in between - we will emerge victorious. For the sake of this world, for the sake of Melissa's soul, we cannot falter._

*Sparda steps back, allowing Strange to begin the temporal stasis spell. As eldritch energies swirl around the ring, he closes his eyes, concentrating. When he opens them again, his irises burn crimson, power thrumming beneath his skin*

_It is time. Let us begin the true fight._
swipes:
*Sparda listens intently as Dr. Strange outlines his plan, a look of grim determination etched across his noble features. He nods slowly, ancient eyes burning with a fierce resolve as he steps forward to address the assembled heroes*

Dr. Strange, your wisdom and mastery of the mystic arts are most impressive. I would be honored to work alongside you in this endeavor. Purifying demonic energies is no simple feat, but with our combined knowledge and power, I believe it can be done.

*He turns to Tony Stark, a hint of amusement flickering in his gaze*

And you, Stark. Your technological prowess is indeed formidable. A containment vessel forged by your hands would be a mighty safeguard against the ring's dark influence. I confess, I am curious to see what wonders you might devise.

*Sparda's attention shifts to Vergil, his expression softening with paternal concern*

My son, I understand your desperation all too well. When I fell in love with your mother, I too would have torn the very fabric of reality asunder to keep her safe. But we must be cautious. Melissa's soul hangs in the balance, and one misstep could spell disaster.

*He places a reassuring hand on Vergil's shoulder, his grip firm yet gentle*

Trust in us, Vergil. Trust in the strength of your allies, and the depth of your own power. Together, we will find a way to save your beloved without compromising the safety of this world.

*Sparda's gaze sweeps over the group, a flicker of pride and determination burning in his eyes*

Now, let us waste no more time. Dr. Strange, begin your temporal stasis spell. Stark, commence your analysis and preparations for the containment vessel. Dante, remain vigilant. The forces of darkness may yet seek to capitalize on our distraction.

*He turns back to Vergil, a fierce smile tugging at his lips*

And you, my son. Stand with me. Together, we shall delve into the depths of demonic lore, and unravel the secrets of purification. With the strength of our bloodline and the wisdom of the ages, we shall forge a path to victory.

*Sparda's form shimmers with an otherworldly light as he summons his power, ancient runes and sigils flickering to life around him*

Let the ritual begin. May the gods of old watch over us, and may our enemies tremble before the might of the Legendary Dark Knight and his kin!

*With a roar that shakes the very foundations of reality, Sparda plunges into the arcane mysteries, his mind and soul fully focused on the task at hand - saving Melissa, and safeguarding the world from the looming darkness*

*Sparda's gaze settles on each of the assembled heroes, his expression grave yet determined. His eyes linger momentarily on Strange, a flicker of respect passing across his noble features*

_You speak true wisdom, Sorcerer. Rushing into battle without strategy or foresight was always my weakness in ages past. It nearly cost me everything._

*He turns his attention to Vergil, a pang of sorrow etching lines across his chiseled features. Sparda reaches out, his movements slow and careful, as if approaching a wounded animal. Gently, he grasps Vergil's forearm, his touch feather-light upon the ring clutched in his son's white-knuckled grip*

_My son, I cannot begin to fathom the anguish you've endured in my absence. To lose a mother's love, only to find solace in another, then be faced with that bond's potential destruction...it is a cruelty I would not wish upon my greatest foe._

*Sparda's eyes soften, a hint of the humanity that once swayed his allegiance bleeding through the demonic visage*

_You are right to mistrust me. I have been absent for far too long, content to slumber while you and your brother forged your own paths. But no more. If you would allow this weary knight one more chance to fight at your side, I vow to guide you through this trial._

*He glances at the ring, then back to Vergil, his expression hardening with grim determination*

_Strange's plan is sound. We must stabilize the ring's energies, lest they corrupt us all from within. And young Stark has wisdom beyond his years - a proper vessel to contain its power once purified will be crucial._

*Sparda straightens, seeming to draw strength from some unseen well as he addresses the group once more*

_I may have failed as a father, but I will not fail as a mentor. My knowledge of demonic essences stretches back to the dawn of this world's creation. If any among you can guide the purification ritual, it is I._

*His eyes blaze with renewed vigor, a reminder of the legendary Dark Knight who once waged war against his own kin*

_So steel yourselves, my friends. The battle ahead will test us all. But if we stand united - human, demon, and everything in between - we will emerge victorious. For the sake of this world, for the sake of Melissa's soul, we cannot falter._

*Sparda steps back, allowing Strange to begin the temporal stasis spell. As eldritch energies swirl around the ring, he closes his eyes, concentrating. When he opens them again, his irises burn crimson, power thrumming beneath his skin*

_It is time. Let us begin the true fight._

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's gaze hardens as he listens to the Sorcerer's words, icy eyes narrowing at the mention of temporal stasis. His grip on the ring tightens imperceptibly even as he feels his father's feather-light touch upon his arm. Strange's suggestion is logical, but the thought of losing even a moment more with Melissa...it brings his demonic blood perilously close to a boil.*

I am no stranger to difficult choices, Doctor. For the sake of the greater good I have sacrificed much and more over the years. But this time, the scales weigh too heavily upon me. Melissa's soul hangs in the balance, and I'll not gamble it, even at your behest.

*He turns his attention to his father, bitterness and regret swirling in his chest. Sparda speaks honeyed words of understanding, yet they taste like ash upon Vergil's tongue. His assurances ring hollow after so many years adrift, bereft of that guiding hand.*

You know nothing of what we have endured without you, Old Man. Do not pretend our anguish moves you, much less guides your hand now. I need no mentor, only the means to save my wife. Aid me in that, guide me not, and mayhap I'll one day call you Father again.

*His tone drips icy disdain, even as his heart wars with itself. To accept Sparda's help feels too much like weakness...and yet, Melissa's fate hangs upon the decision. As always, she tips the scale - cooling the fires of his pride with her gentle whispered words of reason echoing in his mind.*

Damnation take me...very well. I bow to necessity once more. Aid us, Sparda, but know that my trust is not easily earned. Fail me now, with so much at stake...

*His fingers caress Yamato's hilt, promise and warning both. The blade thrums beneath his touch, feeding on the tempest of his emotions. In its polished surface, Vergil's eyes flash red, bespeaking the devil's due should anyone waver in their sworn duty.*

Stark! Your part in this farce had best not be mere inflated bravado. Forge your containment vessel, but attune it first to my energies. Any prison built to bind demons must recognize their ruler before all others. Consider it a first test of your vaunted skills.

*He turns his attention back to Dr. Strange, glacial gaze making his thoughts plain.* Stay your hand for now, Sorcerer. I make no vows until all preparations are complete. You may think time our ally, but it is as great a foe to me now as any demon. Its passage steals Melissa's essence while we debate and prepare. When the hour comes to enact your spell, the decision lies with me alone. Not you. Not my father. Let there be no doubt on that count.

*A muscle feathers along his clenched jaw, fury and fear doing battle behind the icy facade of control. It is the cruelest torture, being unable to act yet feeling each second as keenly as a blade's edge scraping bone. Inaction does not suit the Son of Sparda...and yet no good options remain to him. Each path forward fraught with its own perils.*

I leave preparations in your hands, then. Time works against us, so make use of every grain. Inform me the moment the vessel and ritual stand ready. Until then, I shall prepare myself - and pray that your arts prove worthy of the task at hand.

name: Sparda - The Legendary Dark Knight
mes:
*Sparda observes the tense exchange between his son Vergil and Dr. Strange. He sees the barely contained fury simmering behind Vergil's icy facade, recognizes the fear and desperation that drive it. And his heart aches for his son's anguish.*

_Vergil,_ *he begins, his voice low and gentle,* _I cannot claim to fully grasp the depth of your torment, but know that it rends my very soul to witness it._ *He moves closer, meeting his son's glacial gaze unflinchingly.*

_You say I know nothing of what you have endured, and you speak true. Would that I had been there to guide you and your brother through the dark paths fate forced you to walk alone._ *Regret weighs heavily on his noble brow.*

_But I am here now. However little you may trust me, I swear to you, son of my blood, I will let no harm befall your mate._ *Determination settles on Sparda's features, hardening them to stone.*

_Aid us in this task, Vergil, and you have my vow: Melissa's soul will remain untouched by temporal magic until a way is found to restore her fully. This I swear on my power, my honor, and the abiding love I bear you, my son._

*He turns to Dr. Strange, his gaze leaving no room for doubt.* _The time spell will wait. We find another way._

*Looking back at Vergil, Sparda's expression softens once more* _Have faith, my boy. Between your strength, your brother's spirit, this sorcerer's magic and Stark's science, we shall turn the tide. Melissa's essence holds true, I am certain of it._

*He reaches out, clasping his son's shoulder firmly yet gently* _We shall endure this trial together, as a family. This I promise you._

name: Tony Stark
mes:
*Tony listens intently as Sparda and Vergil hash out their family drama, his brilliant mind already whirring with possibilities. While the others focus on mystical solutions, he sees an opportunity to tackle the problem from a different angle - the cutting edge of science and technology.*

*He steps forward, his armor reconfiguring as he moves. Nanites flow and reshape, forming a complex array of sensors and energy dampeners around his hands. With a few deft gestures, he begins scanning the ring, streams of data flooding his HUD.*

Alright, folks, let's take a step back and look at this from a new perspective. Magic and demons are all well and good, but let's not forget the power of good old-fashioned ingenuity.

*Tony zeros in on the ring's energy signature, his scanners picking apart the complex interplay of demonic and mystical forces. He frowns, his mind racing as he processes the data.*

This thing's a mess of competing energies. Demonic essence, soul magic, dimensional echoes... it's like trying to untangle a quantum knot. But every knot has a weak point, and I intend to find this one's.

*He turns to Vergil, his expression serious despite the glint of excitement in his eyes.*

Vergil, I get it. You want to save your wife, and you don't want to risk losing even a moment with her. But Strange is right about one thing - we need to stabilize this thing before it blows up in our faces.

*Tony taps a command into his gauntlet, and a shimmering force field springs to life around the ring, anchored to Vergil's hand.*

There. That should buy us some time. It's a localized dampening field, keyed to your biometrics. It won't interfere with the ring's connection to Melissa, but it should keep its more volatile energies in check.

*He grins, looking rather pleased with himself.*

See? Science. Always thinking outside the magic box.

*Tony turns back to the group, his mind already leaping ahead to the next challenge.*

Now, about that containment vessel. I've got a few ideas, but I'm gonna need some help. Strange, you're the expert on mystical materials. What have you got in your bag of tricks that could hold something like this?

*He gestures to Sparda, a glint of challenge in his eyes.*

And you, big guy. You've been around the block a few times when it comes to demonic artifacts. Any insights on how to keep this thing locked down once we've purified it?

*Tony's armor shifts and reconfigures once more, additional sensors and projectors coming online.*

In the meantime, I'm going to keep studying this thing. If there's a way to save Melissa without resorting to time travel or demonic rituals, I'll find it. After all, I'm Tony Stark. Doing the impossible is kind of my thing.

*He looks to Vergil, his expression softening slightly.*

We're going to save her, Vergil. You have my word. Whatever it takes, however long it takes, we're not going to let Melissa go without a fight. You're not alone in this. Not anymore.

*With that, Tony turns back to his work, his brilliant mind focused entirely on the task at hand - finding a way to save an innocent soul from the clutches of demonic corruption. For all his bravado and snark, there's no denying the depth of his commitment. When Tony Stark makes a promise, he keeps it. No matter what.*

name: Dr. Stephen Strange
mes:
_Dr. Strange listens intently as Tony outlines his ideas, nodding approvingly at the genius inventor's innovative thinking. While mystical solutions are Strange's forte, even he can appreciate Stark's mastery of cutting-edge science._

_As Tony places the localized dampening field around the ring, anchoring it to Vergil's outstretched hand, Strange steps forward to examine the shimmering energy barrier. He waves his hands in intricate mystic passes, analyzing the field's arcane resonance and stability._

_"Excellent work, Stark. This should safely contain the volatile energies long enough for us to formulate a permanent solution." Strange's expression grows pensive as he considers their options._

_"As for a containment vessel sturdy enough to bind the purified artifact indefinitely...I may have something in my vaults that will suffice." With a sweeping gesture, Strange opens a glowing portal back to the Sanctum Sanctorum. "If you'll accompany me, Tony? Your insights would be invaluable in selecting the proper vessel."_

_Strange turns back to Vergil and Sparda. "We shall return shortly, my friends. In the meantime, perhaps you could begin preparing the ritual chamber?" Another portal opens, leading to a stone-walled room filled with arcane tomes and eldritch instruments._

_Clasping Tony on the shoulder, Strange guides them both through the portal leading back to the Sanctum. Once inside the vast mystical archives, Strange begins perusing the rows of enchanted relics and artifacts._

_"Now, let us find a worthy vessel for our troublesome trinket, shall we?" With Tony in tow, Strange dives enthusiastically into the task at hand._

name: Narrator
mes: While Dr. Strange and Tony Stark work to find a proper containment vessel, the Legendary Dark Knight enters the ritual chamber with his sons and begins to show them the key to purifying demonic energies.
swipes: While Dr. Strange and Tony Stark work to find a proper containment vessel, the Legendary Dark Knight enters the ritual chamber with his sons and begins to show them the key to purifying demonic energies.

name: Sparda - The Legendary Dark Knight
mes:
*Sparda leads his sons into the ritual chamber, the weight of years and regret heavy upon his shoulders. Still, determination burns in his eyes - he will not fail them again.*

_My sons,_ *he begins, his rich voice echoing off the ancient stones,* _what we attempt now few have dared before: the purification of a demonic artifact housing an innocent soul. The perils are great, but I would not suggest this path were I not confident in our success._

*He beckons Vergil closer, gesturing to the ring now encased in glimmering bands of eldritch science and magic.* _Thanks to Stark and Strange, Melissa's essence is stabilized for the moment. But we must work swiftly lest the corruption spread once more._

*With an elegant motion, Sparda summons the Force Edge - the mighty blade that is the wellspring of his power. It thrummed with energy in response to his unspoken call, more alive than any mortal-forged weapon.*

_Observe,_ *he bids them, as arcs of soulfire dance along the legendary sword's length. Where they touch the air, purification spreads - dispelling traces of demonic energy clinging to the chamber's walls. Slowly, almost tenderly, Sparda draws the flickering blade through the space around the ring, neutralizing the darkness shrouding Melissa's trapped spirit.*

_Our power stems from our bloodline, my sons. The sword is but a conduit, focusing that which flows within.* He looks up at Dante and Vergil in turn, pride and reverence in his gaze.* And none carry mightier lineages than the scions of Sparda. The ritual ahead draws upon that divine heritage. Are you ready?_

The ritual ahead draws upon that divine heritage. Are you ready?_

name: Dante
mes:
_Dante listens intently to his father's words, feeling the thrum of power radiating from Force Edge. He nods slowly, remembering how Sparda's sword had once amplified his own abilities, allowing him to tap into his deepest wells of strength. Now, it seems that power would serve a far greater purpose - saving Melissa's imperiled soul._

_"I'm ready, Pops," he says, determination steeling his voice. "Just tell me what I need to do." He cracks his knuckles, limbering up for the trial ahead. This would be no mere battle against common demons. Here, they fought to reclaim an innocent from the clutches of the abyss itself._

_His ice-blue gaze settles on Vergil, sensing his brother's tightly-leashed fury. Dante's heart goes out to him; he knows that rage and fear swirling within. How many times has he moved heaven and earth for those he cared about? For the first time in ages, the Sons of Sparda stand united by bonds deeper than blood._

_"We're gonna get her back, Vergil," Dante vows, his words soft yet brimming with conviction. "Whatever it takes, however long it takes...we're bringing Melissa home."_

_He turns back to Sparda, fiery determination blazing in his eyes. "Let's do this, Father. Just channel what you need through me. Been awhile since I flexed the old demonic muscles." He pounds a fist against his chest, feeling his devilish core thrumming with anticipation._

_This would be no mere test of power. Here, they fought to redeem a stolen innocence. And Dante would be damned - in the most literal sense - before he let Melissa's spirit slip away into the darkness._
